description:
Specials included in the DVD/BD volumes of the anime. They feature original stories written by the series' mangaka, ONE

The first special is titled "Shinobiyori-sugiru Kage" and takes place after Saitama's fight with Mosquito Girl, and it follows Genos as he is persistently and suspiciously prowling after Saitama trying to find out the secret of his strength. Additionally, a mysterious person appears who has a "certain reason" to hold a grudge against Saitama.

2: Hanashibeta-sugiru Deishi
3: Kojire-sugiru Ninja
4: Gouin-sugiru Bang
5: Iroiro Ari-sugiru Kyoudai
6: Fukanou-sugiru Satsujin Jiken

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Superhero
tags.description: Prominently features super-powered humans who aim to serve the greater good.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: Karuta
tags.description: Centers around the game of karuta.

node.description:
**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ONE_rakugaki)** | **[Website](http://galaxyheavyblow.web.fc2.com/)**

One (often stylized as ONE) is a manga artist, best known as the author and creator of [One-Punch Man](https://anilist.co/manga/85364/One-Punch-Man/) and [Mob Psycho 100](https://anilist.co/manga/85189/Mob-Psycho-100/).

He grew up in Konosu, Saitama, and started getting interested in manga when his parents bought him [Crayon Shin-chan](https://anilist.co/manga/32435/Crayon-Shinchan/). ONE also made several manga in the past that never got serialized such as "Sun Man" and "Tennis Player Ryu".

ONE started releasing One-Punch Man on his own website under no official publisher. [A web version](https://anilist.co/manga/74347/One-PunchMan/) was later serialized by Weekly Young Jump with [Yusuke Murata](https://anilist.co/staff/96903/Yusuke-Murata) as the artist. Mob Psycho 100 was serialized in Ura Sunday, the online version of Weekly Shonen Sunday.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/NEBU_KURO)

He was once the assistant and apprentice of Takeshi Obata of _Hikaru no Go_ and _Death Note_ fame. He had a number of one-shots published in Weekly Shonen Jump, namely _Partner_ (won the 122nd Hop*Step award), _Samui Hanashi_ (won the 2nd Prize in the 51st Akatsuka Award), _Kaitou COLT_, and of course, _Eyeshield 21_ (began serialization in Weekly Shonen Jump No. 34 2002).

He is also responsible for designing Dust Man from _Rockman 4_ and Crystal Man from _Rockman 5_.

__Agency:__ Toy's Factory

[Profile](http://www.toysfactory.co.jp/artist/makotofurukawa/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/m_furukawa929)

**Nicknames:** Ao-chan (あおちゃん), Kodomo sensei (こども先生, lit. Child teacher)
__Agency:__ Aoni Production

[Website (Columbia)](https://columbia.jp/yukiaoi) | [Website (FlyingDog)](https://www.jvcmusic.co.jp/flyingdog/-/Artist/A023992.html) | [Profile (Aoni Pro)](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/yuki-aoi.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/staff_aoi/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/aoiyuki_official/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aoi_Yūki) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/悠木碧)

Aoi Yabusaki, better known by her stage name Aoi Yuuki, is a Japanese actress, voice actress and singer represented by Pro-Fit.

Yuuki entered the entertainment industry at the age of four. As a child, she acted in films and dramas. From 1999 to 2002, she made regular appearances on the variety shows Appare Sanma Dai-sensei and Yappari Sanma Dai-sensei which aired on Fuji TV. When she was in fifth grade, she made her debut as a voice actress as [Sakura](https://anilist.co/character/15429/) on [Kino's Journey](https://anilist.co/anime/486/).

In late 2006, she was affiliated with the theater company Central. After her admission to high school in August 2007, she joined the agency Breath, whilst changing her stage name to Aoi Yuuki. In 2008, she got her first major role in [Kure-nai](https://anilist.co/anime/3358/) as [Murasaki Kuhouin](https://anilist.co/character/10174/). In August of the same year, she moved to the agency Pro-Fit.

In October 2011, she won the Newtype award for best lead voice actress for her role as [Madoka Kaname](https://anilist.co/character/37832/) in [Puella Magi Madoka Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/). She was also awarded for Best Lead Actress in the 6th Seiyuu Awards for Madoka Kaname, [Victorique de Blois](https://anilist.co/character/20170/) and [Tooru Ichii](https://anilist.co/character/38904/).

In 2013, Yuuki and [Ayana Taketatsu](https://anilist.co/staff/101996/) formed the singing unit [petit milady](https://anilist.co/staff/116523).

**Non-anime voice roles:** 
- [Lumine](https://anilist.co/character/209682/Ying) - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Gwen Stacy - Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse (Movie); Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse (Movie)
- Renne Bright - Eiyuu Densetsu: Sen no Kiseki IV (VG), Eiyuu Densetsu: Hajimari no Kiseki (VG), Eiyuu Densetsu: Kuro no Kiseki (VG)
- Yurusen - Kamen Rider Ghost (VG)
- Fiona - Xenoblade Chronicles 3 (VG)
- Rita Rossweisse - Honkai Impact 3rd (VG)
- Moddey - Memento Mori (VG)
- Futaba Sakura - Persona 5/Royal (VG)
- Pascal - NieR: Automata (VG) (VG)
- Nian - Arknights (VG)
- Istina - Arknights (VG)
- Ravi & Apocalyptic Ravi - Epic 7 (VG)
- Schneider - Reverse: 1999 (VG)
- Lysithea - Fire Emblem: Three Houses (VG)
- Cinderella - Nikke: Goddess of Victory (VG)
- Sugar - Reverse Collapse: Code Name Bakery (VG)

__Height:__ 175 cm

[Profile](https://intention-k.com/profile/yuichi_nakamura) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/nakamuraFF11) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCReBAqqC-hc9d70gOftfitg) | [Personal YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3eYAvjCVwNHgkaGbXX3sig)

**Trivia:**
- His nickname "Yuu-kyan" was given by Kenichi Suzumura.
- Very close with Tomokazu Sugita. They host a video game variety show called Tokyo Encounter together.
- Loves cats but is afraid of having them die before him, so doesn't have any of his own.
- Allergic to metals and alcohol; drinks non-alcoholic soft drinks or orange juice at parties.
- Colorblind.

__Non-Anime Roles:__

- Louis Guiabern - Metaphor: ReFantazio (VG)
